attributes.action: MP's to give up expenses claim privileges & be paid in line with public sector
attributes.additional_details: My argument is that if MP's wages were in line with the public sector, and they had no 'expenses' claims, more people would be involved in politics that are doing the job for ALL the right reasons- to represent the UK public and vote for things that matter- and to never be awarded pay rises during times of austerity that are far above inflation while expecting the public sector to be subject to a long standing pay cap!
attributes.background: The majority of our gov and our MP's are so distant from the reality of life and how the decisions they make affect the general public it needs a serious overhaul please read on!

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government. 

You can find out how to contact IPSA here: 

http://parliamentarystandards.org.uk/About%20Us/Pages/Contact-Us.aspx
